channel.title: Laggy computer!
channel.description:
Hi,
My computer is really slow, and I know that some of it is down to me, because I've downloaded like 4 programs and alot of stuff like text files and batches. The thing is, I am hoping to speed up my computer by closing alot of processes which do nothing of importance. I'm not entirely sure how to add images, but I'm going to try.
The image is a diagram, much should be explained by it.
[img]http://i534.photobucket.com/albums/ee349/Spartan_E180/har.jpg[/img]
What can I close of the processes listed?
avgrsx.exe will not end, because it sucks like that.
Don't be evil and say something like 'Close all of the SYSTEM processes' if it will do harm, because I might well believe you.
Thanks, Retard Monkey

item.title: Laggy computer!
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

Lol, after i got my mobo back, runescape was lagging for me too, so i thought it was my processor that was shot, went into bios and upped some stuff and its good now.

[quote=“BloodRayne, post:7, topic:235276”]I honestly think reVein is just trying to sound smart, lol.

Yeah like R.I.P said, avgrsx.exe is AVG antivirus, which is designed to not end. That’s why you’re having trouble with that.

svchost.exe is something Windows uses to organize itself, I think. I’m not too good with that. Try going to CMD, and typing in

tasklist /SVC

That lists some information about the svchosts that are running, and what they’re run by. This can give you the information you need if you want to decide whether or not to close them.

Hope this helps, :-)[/quote]
“svchost.exe is a generic host process name for services that run from dynamic-link libraries”

Read full topic

svchost.exe is something Windows uses to organize itself, I think. I’m not too good with that. Try going to CMD, and typing in

item.title: Laggy computer!
item.dc:creator: @Retard_Monkey Retard Monkey
item.description:
@Retard_Monkey wrote:

[code]Microsoft Windows XP [Version 5.1.2600]
© Copyright 1985-2001 Microsoft Corp.

C:\Documents and Settings\username>netstat -n

Active Connections

Proto Local Address Foreign Address State
TCP 81.105.19.79:2982 83.98.28.35:80 CLOSE_WAIT

TCP 81.105.19.79:3801 80.252.91.46:80 ESTABLISHED

TCP 81.105.19.79:3820 84.53.178.81:80 ESTABLISHED

TCP 127.0.0.1:2978 127.0.0.1:2979 ESTABLISHED
TCP 127.0.0.1:2979 127.0.0.1:2978 ESTABLISHED
TCP 127.0.0.1:2980 127.0.0.1:2981 ESTABLISHED
TCP 127.0.0.1:2981 127.0.0.1:2980 ESTABLISHED
TCP 127.0.0.1:3171 127.0.0.1:3172 ESTABLISHED
TCP 127.0.0.1:3172 127.0.0.1:3171 ESTABLISHED

TCP 127.0.0.1:3174 127.0.0.1:3173 ESTABLISHED

C:\Documents and Settings\username>[/code]

Meaning??

item.title: Laggy computer!
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

From what I see on that image, nothing is causing the lag. You are only using 4% of the cpu, and only 17% of your RAM. Try cleaning up your hdd. What’s the size of your pagefile?

Read full topic

item.title: Laggy computer!
item.dc:creator: @Retard_Monkey Retard Monkey
item.description:
@Retard_Monkey wrote:

I know it isn’t much, but playing RS makes me lagg like a cat on stilts.
Which svchost.exes can i close? Also, what do they do…?
I’ve closed about 30 processes to get to this few, but I still lagg.

Any tips on improving performance?

Read full topic

item.title: Laggy computer!
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

You can’t close any of those, except avgrsx.exe (which is avg). And probably svchost but it doesn’t take much of your memory.

But don’t nag, you only have 17 processes running, I have 73.

Read full topic
